title: Involvement
text:
Club Involvement
Lead team for Presbyterian Episcopalian campus ministry. This club promotes community, service, and learning. As a member of the lead team I plan and run events and send monthly updates to churches that donate to our organization.
Scholarship Program
Plemmons Scholars Program. Since my freshman year at App State I have been a part of the Plemmons Scholarship program which is a group of about ten people from each year at App state. We get together to discuss leadership, learn new skills at weekly meetings and hear from community members. Learn more here
Travel Program
Up With People Voices Program. During the Summer and Fall of 2023 I participated in a cultural exchange program where I traveled to four different countries in three months. During this program we put on a show promoting positive change, participated in service projects, and stayed with host families local to the community. Learn more here
Work Experience
YMCA Camp counselor. For the past two summers I have worked as a summer camp counselor at the YMCA. Here I led campers in group activities, such as field trips, crafts, and learning assignments.
App State Dining employee. As a student I work on campus at one of the campus dining location.

title: About Me
text: Hello! My name is Emma McLaughlin. I am a junior at Appalachian State University studying Mathematics with a concentration in Statistics.

title: Combining Data Frames
text:
Loading packages


Code
library(tidyverse)
library(tidybiology)

data(happy)
data(happy_join_one)
data(happy_full)

title: Combining Data Frames
text:
Veiwing the data sets


Code
glimpse(happy)


Rows: 5
Columns: 4
$ country_name   <chr> "Iraq", "Comoros", "Panama", "Maldives", "Spain"
$ ladder_score   <dbl> 4.854, 4.289, 6.180, 5.198, 6.491
$ gdp            <dbl> 9.240, 8.031, 10.350, 9.826, 10.571
$ social_support <dbl> 0.746, 0.626, 0.896, 0.913, 0.932

title: Combining Data Frames
section: Combining happy and happy_join_one by row and column
text:
Combining happy and happy_join_one by row and column


Code
bind_rows(happy, happy_join_one)%>% head(n=3) %>% knitr::kable()

title: Combining Data Frames

Code
happy_join %>% inner_join(happy_join_one)%>% head(n=3) %>% knitr::kable()

title: Combining Data Frames
section: Filtering out countries in happy_full that are also in happy
text:
Filtering out countries in happy_full that are also in happy


Code
happy_full %>% anti_join(happy) %>% head(n=3) %>% knitr::kable()

title: Combining Data Frames
text:
Code
library(tidyverse)


── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ──
✔ dplyr     1.1.4     ✔ readr     2.1.5
✔ forcats   1.0.0     ✔ stringr   1.5.1
✔ ggplot2   3.5.1     ✔ tibble    3.2.1
✔ lubridate 1.9.3     ✔ tidyr     1.3.1
✔ purrr     1.0.2     
── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ──
✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()
ℹ Use the conflicted package (<http://conflicted.r-lib.org/>) to force all conflicts to become errors
